page.title: 07Millbay Cove, Kingswear.
page.content: A group of us went with our teacher along the Kingswear Coastal Footpath to Millbay Cove. The beach is stoney,but sand appears as the tide goes out. There is a freshwater stream running down the middle to the sea. We looked in the rockpools,and found anemones,winkles,limpets and tiny crabs. The anemones were so soft that we could hardly feel them. We climbed the rocks on each side of the bay to look at the wild flowers. We found thrift,sea cabbage and red campion. At the top of the beach is an old boathouse built like a castle.There is also an old slipway and the remains of an old winch. The bay looks very scruffy because there is masses of rubbish on the tide line. We looked for treasure but didn't find any!
